drug.name: Paclitaxel trevatide
drug.description: Three paclitaxel molecules linked by a cleavable succinyl ester linkage to a brain peptide vector, Angiopep-2, conjugate named ANG1005.
drug.indication: Investigated for use/treatment in brain cancer.

drug-interaction.name: Darbepoetin alfa
drug-interaction.description: The risk or severity of Thrombosis can be increased when Darbepoetin alfa is combined with Paclitaxel trevatide.

drug-interaction.name: Erythropoietin
drug-interaction.description: The risk or severity of Thrombosis can be increased when Erythropoietin is combined with Paclitaxel trevatide.

drug-interaction.name: Peginesatide
drug-interaction.description: The risk or severity of Thrombosis can be increased when Peginesatide is combined with Paclitaxel trevatide.

drug-interaction.name: Methoxy polyethylene glycol-epoetin beta
drug-interaction.description: The risk or severity of Thrombosis can be increased when Methoxy polyethylene glycol-epoetin beta is combined with Paclitaxel trevatide.

drug-interaction.name: Digoxin
drug-interaction.description: Digoxin may decrease the cardiotoxic activities of Paclitaxel trevatide.

drug-interaction.description: Acetyldigitoxin may decrease the cardiotoxic activities of Paclitaxel trevatide.
